title: High Reliance on Self-Employment
description: In 2023, 94.54% of the total employment in the Central African Republic was self-employed, with females at 97.59% and males at 91.68%.

title: High Vulnerability in Employment
description: In 2023, 93.32% of the workforce was in vulnerable employment, with 96.80% of females and 90.06% of males affected.

title: High Adolescent Fertility Rate
description: The adolescent fertility rate in 2023 was 163.09 births per 1,000 women aged 15-19.

title: High Birth Rate
description: In 2023, the crude birth rate was 46.36 per 1,000 people, indicating a high population growth rate.

title: High Rate of Early Marriage
description: In 2019, 25.8% of women aged 20-24 were married by age 15, and 61% by age 18.

title: High Child Population
description: In 2023, 49.17% of the total population was aged 0-14, with 51.75% of the male population in this age group.

title: High Age Dependency Ratio
description: In 2023, the age dependency ratio was 105.18%, with young dependents accounting for 100.88% of the working-age population.

title: High Tariff Peaks on Primary Products
description: In 2022, 81.78% of tariff lines on primary products had international peaks, indicating high trade barriers.

title: High Mortality from Air Pollution
description: In 2019, the mortality rate attributed to air pollution was 305.1 per 100,000 population, with males at 364.9.

title: High Lifetime Risk of Maternal Death
description: In 2023, the lifetime risk of maternal death was 4.24%, indicating significant health challenges for women.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Primary Education
description: In 2016, the pupil-teacher ratio in primary education was 83.41, indicating challenges in educational quality.

title: Moderate Use of Banks for Investment
description: In 2023, 56.5% of firms used banks to finance investments, indicating moderate financial sector engagement.

title: High Rate of Female Homicides
description: In 2016, the intentional homicide rate for females was 10.62 per 100,000, highlighting safety concerns.

title: Low Human Capital Index
description: In 2020, the Central African Republic had a Human Capital Index of 0.29, one of the lowest globally, indicating significant challenges in health and education outcomes.

title: Limited Internet Access
description: As of 2019, only 7.51% of the population in the Central African Republic used the internet, highlighting limited digital connectivity.

title: Low Female Literacy Rate
description: In 2020, only 29.11% of females aged 15-24 were literate, indicating significant educational challenges for young women.

title: Poor Access to Basic Drinking Water
description: In 2022, only 48.06% of the urban population had access to basic drinking water services, reflecting inadequate infrastructure.

title: High Maternal Mortality Risk
description: The lifetime risk of maternal death in the Central African Republic was 1 in 24 as of 2023, one of the highest risks globally.

title: Low Operational Efficiency in Financial Services
description: In 2024, the operational efficiency of receiving financial services scored 15.77, indicating inefficiencies in the financial sector.

title: Low Political Stability
description: The Central African Republic ranked in the lower percentile for political stability and absence of violence in 2023, reflecting ongoing instability.

title: Low Female Workforce Participation
description: In 2023, only 2.41% of female employment was in wage and salaried work, indicating limited formal employment opportunities for women.

title: Low Survival Rate to Age 65
description: In 2022, only 7.90% of females and 0.32% of males survived to age 65, highlighting significant health challenges.

title: Low Quality of Public Services
description: In 2024, the quality of public services scored 18.35, indicating significant room for improvement in governance and service delivery.
